727430f-a.title: Queens: Metropolitan Avenue - 75th Street
727430f-a.text:
Metropolitan Avene, north side, between 78th Street (rimnt)
and '5th Street (left), showing in two views the M.E. Church of
Newtown. The congregation organized in 1768 and met in a small
meetirg house, which was erected in 1769, and located on the west
aide of Dry Harbor Road, just south of F)rmanville Avenue. The
church edifice was erected in 1785 and rebuilt in 1836. The
congregation was incorporated in 1836. The church is on the present
site sirce 1836. In 1901 it sas damaged by fire and in 1902 it
was rebuilt and enlarged. It was burned again about Jan. 8, 1926.
In 1929 a brick edifice occupies the site. Between 1886 and 1889
the congregation was dormant.
1922
Views 1and 2
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

727428f-a.title: Queens: Metropolitan Avenue - 75th Street
727428f-a.text:
Metropolitan Avenue, north side, east of 75th Street, showing
in center of the view the M.E. Church of Newtown. Beyond it is the
former Middle Village Hotel owned by J. Schneider.
February 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection

727429f-b.title: Queens: Metropolitan Avenue - 75th Street
727429f-b.text:
Metropolitan Avenue, south side, between 75th and 78Eh Streets,
showing the John B. Ray house of 1872. Next to wis frame house was
a maccaroni factory operated by him in 1873.
1922
View 2: February 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
